text: I love the freshly squeezed lemonade. There club sandwich is so good!

name: Miss Smith
text: Let me say, I truly tried to support. The food is fine. However the woman who is in charge of answering the phone is VERY rude. If the business is busy that is understandable but to continue to put someone on hold for 10-15 minutes at a time talking to customers in the background about who she does or does not know has covid and the cameras in her home and small talking with ppl while I sit here waiting to have my order taken. She has never even given the kind of customer service that I’m overhearing with others right now. I’m disgusted but I guess that’s just the business... Still on hold for the 3rd call.... Oh now she goes “Let me call Manual” or somebody after 20 minutes and the picks up the phone shocked I’m still there and tells me “go on with your order” as if she is disgusted and that I waited!!! Wow. Done!! IT IS FREE TO BE POLITE AND COURTEOUS!!

text:
Asked cashier for a chocolate malt (it’s on their menu... like in big font... all over the walls) “What’s that?” “A chocolate shake with malt?” “Oh we don’t have milk for the shakes.”

None of the toppings were in their named holders so I was guessing as to what was what for stuff that wasn’t apparent.

No hot fudge. No hot caramel. Walnuts in syrup was all dried up.

If Anna Leah and Sidney are working you're in great hands.
When I'm on this side of town I'll definitely be back.

text: I love Freeze Frozen Yogurt!! The tart flavors are my favorite!! The “no sugar added” options is going to be great when I am counting carbs!!

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to review.  We love our new NSA options,too. Look forward to seeing you again!

name: Caroline Carlson
text: Sarah is such a friendly employee. Makes the best frozen yogurt and explains everything so well! She’s the reason I come to Freeze.

name: Laura Conway
text:
I was excited to try Freeze Yogurt Bar based on their previous reviews of great frozen yogurt and friendly staff. My boyfriend and I went into the store around 8:00pm on a Thursday. There were no other customers in the store, and there were two women working. The two workers were mainly interested in talking to each other through the door between the service bar and the kitchen. We were trying to decide what to order, and I asked the staff member named Katherine if she could tell us how about the Acai frozen yogurt. At first Katherine just stared at me, and then she said in a disrespectful tone of voice that was honestly identical to how children and pre-teens make fun of their peers “HA HA Excuse me! What did you just say?” I repeated my question of asking for additional information about the Acai frozen yogurt. To which she responded in the same disrespectful tone “It is pronounced Acai! Oh my gosh!” She then just stood there giggling to herself and still did not provide any information about the Acai frozen yogurt as we requested. This was not a funny situation; it was flat out insulting. I was stunned. We left, of course, and did not buy any products from Freeze Yogurt Bar.

We promptly went across the street to Steel City Pops – where there was a line – and a staff member with outstanding customer service (his name is Jacob - just to give credit where credit is due). Jacob was patient, informative, answered questions, and provided samples. We ended up purchasing double the amount of pops that we planned on because the experience was so outstanding.

After I had calmed down and gathered my thoughts, I went back to Freeze Yogurt Bar to try to explain to the staff member what happened and why it upset me. I knew rationally that I couldn’t expect change – or even awareness – without expressing that information. The other staff member (name unknown) is who talked to me and just kept saying in a disingenuous voice “Oh. I’m sorry about that.” Katherine was also behind the counter, but she avoided eye contact with me and did not offer any sort of apology.

The main take away that I would like the Freeze Yogurt Bar staff to take from this incident is that disabilities are not always physical and cannot always be seen on the outside. You have no idea when one of your customers has a reading disability (or any other kind of disability) and you are behaving incredibly disrespectfully. The damage was done. All that was left was to correct the mistake and apologize, and Katherine (as a representative of the entire business) couldn’t even get it right to own up to what happened and apologize.

resp.text:
We’re sorry to hear of your unsatisfactory experience with Freeze and we offer our sincerest apologies.

With a focus on customer experience, we were surprised by your comments.

If you would like to discuss further, please contact us at guestservices@freezeyogurtbar.com
We would like an opportunity to work towards earning back your business.

Freeze Yogurt Bar

name: IrixGuy's Adventure Channel
text: This stuff is addictive!  I love mixing multiple yogurt flavors as a solid base-layer and then topping it with an excessive amount of crunchy and sugary goodness!  To top off an already epic thing,  I add caramel sauce and the other sauces too!  All ingredients are top-notch and the employees are super friendly!  As a pro tip, eat a pizza next door and then walk here for dessert.  Speaking of walking, a brisk walk the next day is good to burn off all of the goodness!  In all seriousness, one small is likely enough for two adults to share.

name: Martha Bain Boling
text: Love! Great service!

name: Emily Swanson
text:
I’ve been to this location multiple times never having a great experience but the last visit was the last time I’ll give my business to this location.
The girl working was not kind or helpful. I asked for the custard which she said “we are out.” Totally get that- but it’s what I came in for so I asked when it would be ready to serve which she came back with “I don’t know... not today though.” It was barely early afternoon.
I then asked about flavors in the case- which she said “honestly I don’t know what flavor it is- I would have to text my manager.” Not the most encouraging statement. I asked a few more questions but I could tell she was annoyed by my questions, so I picked a flavor quickly to just be done.
When she handed me the cup the custard was already melting over the sides- while I appreciated the generous helping, she stood and watched me as I cleaned up the mess she gave me along with what fell on the counter. No help or offer to help- just watching me struggle.
As a paying customer, I do expect to have some sort of kindness and helpfulness when I am giving you my business. I understand that it is “only $5 worth of custard” but some level of customer service instead of treating someone as an burden will get you a long way. I truly hope this location steps up on there employee training as this is not my first bad experience.

name: Suzanne Taylor
text: Liked it but would of liked to see them carry cherry flavor ice more.

name: Kirk Fogg
text: Disgusting, female shift manager is an idiot too. Did you know they take a metal stick with a flat spatula like head and dip it into chemical water to clean it, then would stick it back into the italian ice to soften it every hour? The machines are crusted with bacteria and germs too at the nuzzles for the frozen custard. These people are making others sick. Don't buy from here. Take it from a former employee. I worked there for one day. Was my last day too. Indian guy and his wife who own the store allow this. They should be sued. I for one may call the health department.

name: Kelly Grace
text: Being from up north we are huge Rita’s fans which is why we were excited to see a Rita’s in Dothan. However this must be one of the only Rita’s that doesn’t have chocolate or even the classic cherry water ice flavors. Hopefully they will get the classics!
